questions.question: She is ……………………. to take her own decisions now.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective, it goes after that adjective.

questions.question: Girls mature ………………………….. than boys.
questions.description: Earlier is the correct comparative expression.

questions.question: The body ………………………. maturity earlier than the mind.
questions.description: There is no preposition after reach.

questions.question: ……………………… we will see you tomorrow.
questions.description: Maybe means perhaps. May in may be is an auxiliary verb indicating probability.

questions.question: Many elderly people don’t have the …………………………. to travel.
questions.description: Means can mean money, resources or funds.

questions.question: How could anyone be so ……………………..?
questions.description: Mean can mean malicious or vicious.

questions.question: I don’t want anyone to ………………………. in my affairs.
It takes a lot of ………………………. to fight bulls.
The lawyer tried to ………………………….. between the company and the union.
questions.description: To mediate is to intervene or negotiate. To meditate is to think, ponder or reflect.

questions.question: She spends hours admiring ……………………….. in the mirror.
questions.description: We use the reflexive pronoun when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: I don’t approve of whisky but I am not averse …………………….. a glass of wine now and then.
Cats have an aversion ………………………. wet.
questions.description: The to here is a preposition. When to is a preposition, it is followed by a noun or ing form.
